de.nec.nle.siafu.model

Class Position

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.nec.nle.siafu.model.Position
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Publishable, Serializable, Comparable<Position>

    public class Position
extends Object
implements Serializable, Comparable<Position>, Publishable

    This class represents a position in the simulator map. Note that the simulator works on two coordinate systems:

    • A row-column grid (from top left to bottom right)
    • A translation of those rows and columns into coordinates, using the map calibration

    The pretty coordinates methods allow you to go from one to the other.

    Author:
    Miquel Martin
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Position

        public Position(int i,
        int j)
         throws PositionOutOfTheMapException
        Create a position.
        Parameters:
        i - the row of the map. Top is 0
        j - the column of the map. Left is 0
        Throws:
        PositionOutOfTheMapException - if you define a position outside the map

      • Position

        public Position(double lat,
        double lon)
         throws PositionOutOfTheMapException
        Create a position using coordinates. The coordinates are then translated to rows and columns using the calibration provided in the config file.
        Parameters:
        lat - the latitude
        lon - the longitude
        Throws:
        PositionOutOfTheMapException - if those coordinates map to a position outside the map

      • Position

        public Position(Position p)
         throws PositionOutOfTheMapException
        Create a position by copying an existing position.
        Parameters:
        p - the position to copy
        Throws:
        PositionOutOfTheMapException - if the original position is out of the map

      • Position

        public Position(String str)
         throws NumberFormatException,
                PositionOutOfTheMapException
        Create a position from a string of the type "row.col".
        Parameters:
        str - the position string
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - if row or col are not integer numbers
        PositionOutOfTheMapException - if the row and column map to a position outside the map.

      • Position

        public Position(FlatData flatData)
        Builds a Position as defined by a FlatData object. Internally, the latitude and longitude is converted to a row and column in the simulator's matrix.
        Parameters:
        flatData - the flat data string with the latitude and longitude

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(World worldObj,
              double[] topRight,
              double[] bottomRight,
              double[] bottomLeft)
        Initialize the position system to match the simulated world. Invoquing this method initializes the static CoordinateTool which assists in calculating latitude and longitudes back and forth from the Siafu row/col position system. You must run this method once before Positions can be created.
        Parameters:
        worldObj - the simulation world
        topRight - an array with the latitude and longitude of the top right corner of the provided background map
        bottomRight - an array with the latitude and longitude of the bottom right corner of the provided background map
        bottomLeft - an array with the latitude and longitude of the bottm left corner of the provided background map

        public String toString()
        Print the position in the form "row.col".
        Overrides:

        Returns:
        the String representing the position

        Returns:
        the hashcode of the toString() output

      • calculateMove

        public Position calculateMove(int rawDir)
                       throws PositionOnAWallException
        Calculate the resulting position if the you were to move in the direction given by dir.
        Parameters:
        rawDir - the direction in which to calculate the movement. it will be normalized to modulo 8
        Returns:
        a new Position object with the resulting position, if the resulting position is not a wall
        Throws:
        PositionOnAWallException - if the resulting position is a wall.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object o)
        Equals method which returns true if the positions have the same row and column.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        o - the object to compare this position to
        Returns:
        true if the positions are equal

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Position p)
        The comparable interface for positions. A position compares larger than another one if the row is lower or, being in equal rows if the column is more to the left. In other words, bottom left, tiny, top right, big.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface Comparable<Position>
        Parameters:
        o - the object to compare to
        Returns:
        an integer according to the comparable interface

      • isNear

        public boolean isNear(Position pos)
        Check if a position is near another, in terms grid points. The maximum distance is 15.
        Parameters:
        pos - the position to check
        Returns:
        true if the positions are near each other

      • isNear

        public boolean isNear(Position pos,
             int radius)
        Check if a position is near another, in terms grid points. The maximum distance is given by radius.
        Parameters:
        pos - the position to check
        radius - the maximum distance to consider as near
        Returns:
        true if the positions are near each other

      • getCoordinates

        public double[] getCoordinates()
        Get the latitude and longitude associated to this position.
        Returns:
        a double array with the latitude as the first value, and the longitude as the second

      • getPrettyCoordinates

        public String getPrettyCoordinates()
        Get a String with the pretty printed coordinates represented by this Position object.
        Returns:
        the pretty formated coordinates string
        See Also:

        public FlatData flatten()
        Flattens the data in this Position object into the form: de.nec.nle.siafu.model.Position:Lat#Lon where Lat and Lon are the latitude and longitude in decimal format.
        Specified by:
        flatten in interface Publishable
        Returns:
        the flattened position

      • getRow

        public int getRow()
        Get the row for this position. The first row, 0, is on top of the map.
        Returns:
        the row number

      • setRow

        public void setRow(int newI)
        Set the row for this position. The first row, 0, is on top of the map.
        Parameters:
        newI - the row number

      • getCol

        public int getCol()
        Get the column for this position. The first column, 0, is on the left side of the map.
        Returns:
        the row number

      • setCol

        public void setCol(int newJ)
        set the column for this position. The first column, 0, is on the left side of the map.
        Parameters:
        newJ - the row number
